materials: Plastic #1 (PETE); Plastic #2 (HDPE); Plastic #2 (Color HDPE); Plastic #3 (PVC); Plastic #4 (LDPE); Plastic #5 (Polypropylene); Plastic #6 (Polystyrene); Plastic #7; Aerosol Spray Cans; Aluminum Cans; Aluminum; Books (Reuse); Glass (Brown); Brown Paper Bags; Cardboard; Catalogs; Cell Phones; Glass (Clear); Clothing; CD/DVD/Blu-ray/UHD discs; Compact Fluorescent Lights; Computer Paper; Drink Boxes; Electronics; Hard Drives; Fluorescent Lamps/Tubes; Gift Boxes; Glass (Green); Greeting Cards; Inkjet Printer Cartridges; Magazines; Mercury Containing Items; Milk Cartons; Paper (Mixed); Newspapers; Ni-Cd Batteries; Other Batteries; Plastics (Other); Packing Peanut (Reuse); Latex Paint; Paperboard; Phone books; Plastic Shopping Bags; Batteries (Rechargeable); Holiday Lights; Tin or Steel Cans; Laser Toner Cartridges; Used Motor Oil; VHS & Cassette Tapes; Office Paper; Small Appliances; Food Scraps; Food Storage Bags
notes: Center is open to Cambridge residents only and small businesses and non-profit organizations in Cambridge with 50 employees or fewer. Use of the Center is free of charge.

name: Verizon Wireless

name: The Verizon Wireless Trade-In Program allows you to trade in your used handset or tablet in a convenient and responsible way.

Verizon Wireless works every day to protect our environment and give our customers opportunities to do the same. Click here for more examples of the earth-friendly initiatives and programs Verizon Wireless is proud to offer and support."
Call2Recycle at the Home Depot
materials: Cell Phones; Compact Fluorescent Lights; Ni-Cd Batteries; Li-Ion Batteries; Ni-MH Batteries; Ni-Zn Batteries; Small Sealed Lead Acid Batteries; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Computer Peripherals; Small Electronics; Small Televisions; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: The Home Depot accepts used rechargeable batteries and compact fluorescent bulbs. Look for the orange drop boxes, usually located near the front entrance near the customer service desk, or ask a store associate for more details.

name: Home Depot
